I've tried with my non-gamer girlfriend and it didn't go as expected, but I do think it's a great game to play period.

You can't go wrong with this game. It's brilliant, amusing and all in all a fun game that one must play. You do not want to miss the cake, after all!

When I grew up someone told me that space could be "folded" to allow "worm holes" to traverse "space time" to allow "space ships" to cross space quickly because they can skip the "intervening space". None of that ever made any sense to me until I played the game "Portal" by Gabe Newell. In this "video game" you "take control" of "physical reality" and puncture it repeatedly with a gun until a big robot dies of "heart break". You see, I was able to create a "worm hole" in the "plot line" of this "video game" in order to short-circuit the guts of the story and get right to the "spoilers". "Aperture technology" can come in handy in more situations than simply murdering our "artificially intelligent" "friends". Come to think of it it was Data from Star Trek The Next Generation who told me that thing about how "space time" works. I don't think he'd really appreciate you going around killing "GLaDOS". He'd probably freak the fuck out like he did in that episode where that chick made robots.

Because despite your violent behavior, the only thing you have managed to break so far is my heart.

This game is pure excellence.
Can't wait for Portal 2

My Rating: 10/10

Blue hole
PORTAL IS DEH SHIT! play it. now.

I was just as excited about getting this with The Orange Box as I was about getting Half-Life 2 Episode 2, even though that’s why I bought The Orange Box. 

I knew Portal was going to involve puzzles that had you move yourself and other objects around by placing the two endpoints of a portal, but I wasn’t expecting to be hilariously insulted by a robot overseer and notice tie-ins with the Half-Life series.  While the portal gun is great fun by itself, what really makes this game is the writing.  It’s so much more fun to accomplish something and then be cut down by the sarcastic voice of your only companion.

It’s not just thinking that gets you through the test chambers either — some of them also require the agility to get the timing just right.  You can almost feel the wind in your hair as you drop into a portal and fling yourself across the room, firing a new set of portals before you land.

The main downside to Portal is that it’s not very long.  The Orange Box pricing still made it a great deal but it’s difficult to be introduced to the portal gun but only have 19 test chambers to use it in.  Fortunately, there's a Portal 2 and it's even better!

This game remains fun the third time through. The last few achieves are super-hard though and get boring. 8.5/10.
THE CAKE IS A LIE

Ah cake. Delicious cake. And Portals that rip holes in space. A match made in heaven. Enter Portal: a critically acclaimed 3D puzzle game that puts the player in the role of Chell, a woman lost within the confines of the Aperture Science building with nothing but quick wit and gun capable of ripping the very fabric of space asunder. And a tempermental Artificial Intelligence that is totally not trying to kill you.  If you like narritive driven masterpieces, you will definitely want to add Portal to your collection today.
Best puzzle solving game ever made. I recommend this game to anyone who has not played it yet. Also Portal 2 will be even better when it comes out
One of the best games ever made. Funny, unique, challenging. Just a bit too short.

If you like puzzles, action, and a humorous storyline (All in the name of getting cake for all your hard effort) then this game is worth the $10. Grab a good grip on that Aperture Science Handheld Portal Device and learn a new way to travel, by portal. With over 20 test chambers, plenty of Turrets, Acid pits and the infamous Companion Cube, you will enjoy playing this game over and over. 

"Find out why all your friends keep telling you "The cake is a lie.""

Portal a su rapidement devenir un jeu culte, malgré sa durée de vie bien trop courte et son scénario totalement inexistant, laissant au joueur le plaisir d'imaginer une histoire derrière un concept simple, mais terriblement efficace.

Son seul défaut est probablement l'équipe de développeur qui avec plus de motivation et de temps, auraient pu faire plus, bien plus.

Portal c'est ça, du plaisir, mais aussi de la frustration.

Best Original Game Mechanic (the portal gun) #1 Video Game Villain (GLaDOS), and Best Sidekick (Weighted Companion Cube} in one of the most influential games of the first decade of the 21st century. The best puzzle game for the PC with unique gameplay and dark, deadpan humor.

Warum soll ich ein Spiel empfehlen, welches sowieso jeder kennt?!

Zu Portal braucht man nicht viel sagen, ausser: Wo ist der 2. Teil?! Das Spiel ist ein leicht hektisches Rätselspiel mit der "innovativen" Portaltechnik.

Allerdings muss auch hier Teil 2 eine Menge wieder gut machen, was die Spieldauer betrifft. Auch dieses Spiel ist mir persönlich viel zu kurz gehalten.

Inovador jogo de primeira pessoa em um tipo de quebra-cabeças (de "tiro") onde a protagonista é um "rato de laboratório" de Glados, uma inteligência artificial que, além de pancadinha da cabeça, é uma baita mentirosa: promete uma festinha com bolo ao final do jogo, quando na verdade... Ah, Glados, Glados! Curiosa reviravolta nos 2/3 do jogo e um final com a música "Still Alive", que virou sucesso no meio. Excelente, imperdível.

Awesome!!!! The Cake is a lie, and your now thinking with portals!

"The cake is a lie."

You probably saw this line on several game-aware websites or geek forums. This is the game that will let you understand why it is so famous. You will enter a universe that is unique, incredibly cute and dangerous at the same time; maybe this is why Portal is so particular.

Your brain will be your best friend: you got no weapon, besides a gun that fires two linked portals. The designers made the levels in a clever way with several solutions to pass through them. But what is even more amazing is that you don't even *see* the other ways until you launch the "hard" version of the levels: indeed, you even have more challenges waiting for you in the very same rooms that you passed in the normal adventure. And you'll see that...

...you'll finally start thinking like Portal.
This is a great game filled with puzzels and excitement, I suggest for you all to buy it.
Great game, short but worthy of the buy.

I don't know how to describe a video game with such zen mechanics and intriguing puzzles.  The story is simple and unpretentious, but there is was evidently so much skill put into the story creation that the player is left coming back to rethink the basic concepts of who is the real antagonist - GladOS or the player-character?  This game is possibly a piece of art pretending to be a game.
パズル＋FPSの秀作。買い。
Short, fun, challenging and funny.

How can anyone dislike this game?  I don't think I've met one person who's played Portal and hasn't enjoyed it.  It's just long enough that you'll probably beat it within a few hours, or a couple of days, max.  But it's worth it!  It's a puzzle game in the form of a first person shooter, with a great plot and fun characters.
He perdido la cuenta de las veces que he comprado ya este juego... Y siempre me parece que he pagado demasiado poco por él. Imprescindible.
A unique game, very innovative, great gameplay, great storyline. Valve really knows how to please a gamer.

É difícil dizer que um jogo é o melhor que você já jogou. Cada um pode ser o melhor dentro da sua proposta. E Portal, é sensacional. Ele consegue junta o estilo FPS ( Atirador em Primeira Pessoa), com quebra quebra-cabeça. Em vez de armas de aniquilação, você carrega a Aperture Science Handheld Portal Device - ASHPD -, também conhecida como "portal gun", também prefiro chamar assim ^^, para abrir portais que ligam dois pontos que você criou. O enredo me lembra um filme composto por uma trilogia chamada O Cubo: Você acorda em um lugar totalmente desconhecido, onde você é provavelmente uma cobaia de um projeto estranho e uma voz vinda de um sistema de som te orienta, com pouquíssimas informações, sobre o que você tem fazer. Se falhar nos desafios... Já era.... O 2 ainda não foi lançado, mas está com certeza no meu Wishlist !
